oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spiller & Burr .36 caliber reproduction pistol and holster
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Early reproduction pistol stamped on barrel, "Spiller Burr .36 caliber pistol, CSA, 1861-1861." [The dates are written as is.] The pistol is in near-pristine condition and has a leather holster marked "F36." Spiller & Burr, which manufactured more than 1500 pistols (only one-tenth of the order) for the Confederacy, ceased production at the end of the war. The company moved from Richmond to Atlanta to Macon to avoid Federal capture.
